title: '£2000 a year to watch s***... f*** off!' Arsenal fans direct abuse at Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang
text:
Footage has emerged of Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang receiving abuse from Arsenal fans while stuck in traffic following Sunday's draw against Crystal Palace.

A video posted on Twitter shows a number of supporters surrounding Aubameyang's chrome Lamborghini Aventador as he tries to make his way home from the Emirates Stadium.

One fan can be heard shouting: '£2,000 a year to watch s***… f*** off!’

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was targeted when driving away from the Emirates on Sunday

Arsenal supporters can be heard on video footage abusing the Gabon international

Aubameyang played in Arsenal's disappointing 2-2 draw at home to Crystal Palace

Another adds: 'These people pay £1,800 for a season ticket… they are your support!’

It comes after Granit Xhaka was heavily criticised for telling Arsenal supporters to 'f*** off' during the 2-2 draw at the weekend.

Xhaka was jeered as he left the pitch after being substituted in the second half.

The incident has led Arsenal boss Unai Emery to defend Xhaka, who has said the Switzerland international 'is devastated and sad about the situation'.

Granit Xhaka was jeered off the pitch after being substituted just after hour mark

The Arsenal skipper then cupped his hand to his ear as he was hauled off in the second half

Emery has spoken individually to Xhaka although it is not clear whether that relates to him holding onto the Arsenal captaincy.

Emery refused to say whether the 27-year-old would keep the armband but did admit on Tuesday how bad Xhaka felt about the situation.

'It's not easy for him and for the team,' Emery said. 'He is now devastated. Devastated and sad. We spoke yesterday and on Sunday night I also spoke.

Arsenal boss Unai Emery admitted the skipper was wrong after the final whistle

Xhaka took his shirt off in frustration as left the pitch during the Premier League clash

'This morning, he trained as normal with the group but he is devastated and he is sad about the situation. His commitment with the club is a great commitment every time. He wants to help.

'His behaviour was perfect in training, with the group and with the club. He knows he was wrong. He was wrong and he feels it inside very deeply. But that is normal as a human.'
description: Footage has emerged of Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang receiving abuse from Arsenal fans while stuck in traffic following Sunday's draw against Crystal Palace.
